s.text: If you then will read the Storie, First, prepare you to be sorry That you never knew till now, Either whom to love, or how: But be glad, as soon with me, When you know, that this is she, Of whose Beautie it was sung, She shall make the old man young, Keepe the middle age at stay, And let nothing high decay, Till she be the reason why, All the world for love may die.

In couplets and the "beheaded" (first syllable omitted) four-foot iambic line, familiar from "Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star," he speaks his mind directly and eloquently about feeling love ardently when no longer a youth.
